meanings.definition: To raise or lift incorrectly or improperly.
meanings.sent1: He tried to misraise the heavy box, but it fell and broke.
meanings.sent2: She tends to misraise her hand when answering questions in class.
meanings.sent3: The robot misraised the flag upside down, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The magician misraised the curtain to reveal the disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The chef misraised the cake out of the oven, burning his hand.

meanings.definition: To raise or increase in an inadequate or insufficient manner.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to misraise the prices, leading to customer complaints.
meanings.sent2: They had to misraise the fence to keep the dog from escaping.
meanings.sent3: The student misraised the volume on the radio, startling everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The gardener misraised the plants, causing them to wither from lack of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The coach misraised the team's morale with his harsh criticism.
